item.title: 美国就业报告公布前，货币对冲再次变得昂贵
item.description: 夏季过后，货币市场的套期保值成本正在上升，交易员们认为周五的关键性美国就业报告将带来更大的价格波动。【原文：The cost of hedging in the currency market is rising after the summer lull, with traders positioning for wider price swings around Friday’s key US jobs report.】

item.title: 摩根大通将于明年推出德国消费银行以推动增长
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co）计划从明年第二季度开始在德国提供零售银行业务，这标志着这家美国贷款机构在欧洲最大经济体的业务大幅扩展。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co plans to start offering retail banking in Germany from the second quarter of next year, marking a substantial expansion for the US lender in Europe’s largest economy.】

item.title: 牙买加总理霍尔内斯赢得选举，罕见地第三次连任
item.description: 牙买加总理安德鲁-霍尔内斯（Andrew Holness）赢得了罕见的第三次连任，因为选民们对他的政府在过去十年中减少债务、失业和犯罪率给予了奖励。【原文：Jamaican Prime Minister Andrew Holness won a rare third term as voters rewarded his administration for bringing down debt, unemployment and crime over the last decade.】

item.title: 瑞士通胀率连续第三个月超过零，令瑞士央行松了一口气
item.description: 瑞士通胀率连续第三个月保持正值，这为政策制定者吃下了一颗定心丸，因为他们还要评估经济能否经受住美国关税的跳涨。【原文：Swiss inflation stayed positive for a third consecutive month, offering reassurance to policymakers as they also evaluate if the economy can weather a jump in US tariffs.】

item.title: 湿疹新药试验结果令人失望，赛诺菲业绩下滑
item.description: 赛诺菲公司治疗特应性皮炎的实验性药物在后期试验中的疗效低于预期，令投资者大失所望。【原文：Sanofi’s experimental drug for the skin condition atopic dermatitis disappointed investors in a late stage trial, after the benefit of the drug was less than expected.】

item.title: 政治动荡减弱，外国人重返泰国股市
item.description: 随着周五将提名新总理，政治不确定性有所缓和，全球资金又开始流入泰国股市。【原文：Global funds are dipping back into Thai stocks as political uncertainty eases with a new prime minister set to be nominated on Friday.】

item.title: 汇兑银行股价因芯片轮换和权重变化而下跌
item.description: Cambricon Technologies Corp. 股价周四创下近五个月来的最大跌幅，原因是投资者纷纷抛售近期大涨的股票。【原文：Cambricon Technologies Corp. shares tumbled by the most in nearly five months on Thursday as investors rotated out of recent winners following its meteoric rise.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行家 Woeber 表示，人工智能的蓬勃发展将带来价值超过 1000 亿美元的交易
item.description: 据巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）的顶级交易商称，人工智能领域的军备竞赛增加了明年此时达成价值超过 1000 亿美元的并购交易的可能性。【原文：The arms race in artificial intelligence has increased the likelihood of a $100 billion-plus M&A deal by this time next year, according to the top dealmaker at Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 亚洲出口枢纽显示，即使在关税之后，出口活动依然活跃
item.description: 在美国 "对等关税 "生效一个月后，亚洲出口中心的经济表现出人意料的强劲，缓解了促使经济学家下调增长预期和地区央行警告下行风险的担忧。【原文：Asia’s export hubs are showing surprisingly robust economic results a month after US “reciprocal tariffs” came into force, easing fears that prompted economists to cut growth projections and regional central banks to warn of downside risks.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑走低，英国股市将上涨

item.description: 香港的短期融资成本本周已从高位回落，分析师称，本地利率在上个月飙升后似乎已经见顶。【原文：Hong Kong’s short-term funding costs have come off their highs this week, with analysts saying local interest rates look to be peaking after they spiked higher last month.】

item.title: 印尼美元交易增加，印尼国家石油公司寻求 25 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印尼国有石油巨头印尼国家石油公司（PT Pertamina）正在寻求一笔 25 亿美元的短期贷款，这可能是印尼今年最大的一笔美元交易。【原文：Indonesia’s state-owned oil giant PT Pertamina is seeking a $2.5 billion short-term loan, according to people familiar with the matter, in what could be among the biggest dollar deals in the nation this year.】

item.title: 印度出口商游说印度央行削弱卢比以抵消美国关税
item.description: 印度出口商表示，他们将游说央行允许他们暂时以比当前水平低 15%的卢比汇率兑换美国业务收益，以帮助减轻唐纳德-特朗普总统的惩罚性关税带来的打击。【原文：Indian exporters said they will lobby the central bank to allow them to temporarily convert proceeds from their US business at a rupee rate that’s 15% lower than current levels, to help cushion the blow from President Donald Trump’s punitive tariffs.】

item.title: 新西兰为何放宽对外国富人的房产规定
item.description: 今年 4 月，新西兰政府发现自己陷入了困境。它刚刚重新启动了黄金签证计划，为富有的外国人提供居住权，以换取至少 500 万新西兰元（约合 300 万美元）的投资。但其中存在一个重大障碍：现行法律禁止这些投资者买房居住，从而削弱了移居新西兰的主要吸引力之一。【原文：In April, New Zealand’s government found itself in a bind. It had just relaunched its golden visa program, offering wealthy foreigners residency in exchange for a minimum NZ$5 million ($3 million) investment. But there was a major hitch: existing laws prevented those investors from buying a home to live in — undercutting one of the main draws of relocating.】

item.title: 美国数据公布前，铜价从五个月高位回落的幅度扩大
item.description: 在本周晚些时候美国公布关键就业数据之前，基本金属大面积回落，伦敦金属交易所铜价连续第二天下跌。【原文：Copper fell for a second day on the London Metal Exchange, as base metals staged a broad retreat ahead of key jobs data from the US later this week.】

item.title: 日本 30 年期债券销售需求与 12 个月平均水平持平
item.description: 尽管全球债券大跌和国内政治困境影响了投资者的胃口，但日本周四的 30 年期国债拍卖仍满足了市场需求，与 12 个月的平均水平基本持平。【原文：Japan’s 30-year government bond auction Thursday met demand that was broadly in line with its 12-month average even as a global bond selloff and domestic political woes weighed on investor appetite.】

item.title: 据说 DigitalBridge 的 Vantage 正在权衡 16 亿美元的 Yondr 交易

item.title: 特斯拉称其机器人出租车应用程序已向公众开放
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc. ）表示，它已经向公众开放了机器人出租车应用程序，这表明该公司将很快在德克萨斯州奥斯汀的部分早期用户之外推出这项服务。【原文：Tesla Inc. said it has opened its robotaxi app to the general public, suggesting the company will soon roll out the service beyond a select group of early access users in Austin, Texas.】

item.title: 路透社称，随着需求降温，比亚迪下调全年销售目标
item.description: 比亚迪公司将全年销售目标下调了近 20%，原因是中国本土市场的激烈竞争侵蚀了其利润。【原文：BYD Co. has slashed its full-year sales target by almost 20% as intense competition in its home market of China eats into profits.】

item.title: 特朗普将在重修后的玫瑰园接待美达公司扎克伯格和科技公司首席执行官们
item.description: 包括 Meta Platforms 公司的马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）、苹果公司的蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）和微软公司的萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）在内的科技行业领袖预计将于周四出席由第一夫人梅拉尼娅-特朗普（Melania Trump）主持的人工智能活动，然后与唐纳德-特朗普总统一起参加在新装修的玫瑰园举行的晚间招待会。【原文：Tech industry leaders including Meta Platforms Inc.’s Mark Zuckerberg, Apple Inc.’s Tim Cook, and Microsoft Corp.’s Satya Nadella are expected to attend an artificial intelligence event hosted by First Lady Melania Trump on Thursday and then join President Donald Trump for an evening reception in the newly renovated Rose Garden.】

item.title: 卡塔尔航空公司计划扩大中国客运和货运航班规模

item.description: 据一家主要生产商称，中国的多晶硅行业与太阳能供应链的其他环节一样，一直在努力应对严重的产能过剩问题。【原文：China’s polysilicon sector, which along with the rest of the solar supply chain has been grappling with severe overcapacity, is at a clear turning point after recent meetings with the government to address the issue, according to a major producer.】
